io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class Ports

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.Ports
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Ports
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable

    Entry Point Provides utilities for ad-hoc coordination of port usage for distributed systems in tests and lab environments.

    For example, when you do integration testing for a distributed system, and you want to run a couple of tests in parallel you need to make sure that none of the test environments shares ports and file paths with the others.

    To achieve that, you can use the Ports class to allocate the ports and tweak the app configuration in application-specific manner. See the user manual for details and more use-cases.

    This class has explicit lifecycle as follows:

    
     Ports p = new Ports(...);
     // CONFIGURE: call withExporter(...), reservePort(id[, offset]), withPorts(...) as needed
     p.freeze(...);
     // USE: call getBasePort() and port(id)
     p.close();
     // DEAD: any method call would result in exception

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Ports.BlockRegistrar
      A simple block-based allocation strategy, trying to bind a port at a fixed offset from portBase and on failure, retrying again at a new portBase, one block-size up.
      static interface  Ports.Exporter
      A hook notified about allocated ports, and optionally validating them.
      class  Ports.PortsSpecBuilder
      Typesafe builder implementation, used by extensions for specifying ports and offsets.
      static class  Ports.PortVetoException
      Indicates that one of the exporters did not like an allocated port and requests re-allocation of a new block.
      static interface  Ports.Registrar
      A strategy for allocating a port block.
      static interface  Ports.SpecIdBuilder
      Builder interface used to provide constrained, typesafe DSL.
      static interface  Ports.SpecOffsetBuilder
      Builder interface used to provide constrained, typesafe DSL.

      void close()
      Releases all resources and transitions the internal state, so that a call to any methods other than close() will result in IllegalStateException.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ports

        public Ports(@NotNull
             @NotNull Ports.Registrar registrar)

        Creates new ports allocator with the specified registrar and default dynamic port allocation strategy.

        The default port allocation strategy assigns offsets to the dynamic port ID's starting from the base port of the block and skipping all explicitly assigned offsets.

        Parameters:
        registrar - defines a strategy for allocating a port block.

      • Ports

        public Ports(@NotNull
             @NotNull Ports.Registrar registrar,
             @Nullable
             @Nullable Supplier<Integer> dynamicPortFinder)

        Creates new ports allocator with the specified registrar and default dynamic port allocation strategy.

        Parameters:
        registrar - defines a strategy for allocating a port block.
        dynamicPortFinder - defines a strategy for dynamically allocating ports within a block. If null, a default strategy assigns offsets to the dynamic port ID's starting from the base port of the block and skipping all explicitly assigned offsets.

    • Method Detail

      • withExporter

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Ports withExporter(@NotNull
                                            @NotNull Ports.Exporter exporter)

        Registers an Ports.Exporter that would be used to publish/validate the allocated ports. Can throw Ports.PortVetoException to reject a port and force the port allocator to use another block

        If more than one exporter is registered, exporters will be called in their registration order.

        If the implementation of this interface also implements AutoCloseable, the close() method will be called after all offsets have been exported and successfully validated, after the allocation is confirmed successful.

        Parameters:
        exporter - a callback to publish or validate an allocated port.
        Returns:
        this instance for chaining.
        See Also:
        Ports.Exporter.batching(Consumer)

      • reservePort

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Ports reservePort(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull String id,
                                           int offset)
        Registers a port ID at desired offset within the block. Should be called as many times as needed before freeze(int).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the port we are registering. Should be unique.
        offset - the desired offset for the finally allocated port. Should be unique.
        Returns:
        this instance for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is not unique within the scope of this instance.
        IllegalArgumentException - if this port allocator has already been frozen or closed
        See Also:
        reservePort(String), withPorts(int, Consumer)

      • reservePort

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Ports reservePort(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull String id)
        Registers a port ID at automatically chosen offset within the block. Should be called as many times as needed before freeze(int).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the port we are registering. Should be unique.
        Returns:
        this instance for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the ID is not unique within the scope of this instance.
        IllegalArgumentException - if this port allocator has already been frozen or closed
        See Also:
        reservePort(String, int), withPorts(int, Consumer)

      • withPorts

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Ports withPorts(int basePortHint,
                                         @NotNull
                                         @NotNull Consumer<Ports.SpecIdBuilder> spec)
        Configures port IDs and freezes this allocator in one step. Uses a builder based DSL (see example). Should be called only once, IMPORTANT: internally it calls freeze(basePortHint). 
        
 p.withPorts(5000, register -> {
     register.id("foo");
     register.id("bar").offset(1);
     register.id("baz").offset(2);
     register.id("qux");
 });
 assert p.getBasePort()==5000; // p is ready to use
        Parameters:
        spec - a closure configuring the builder (see example above).
        basePortHint - the desired base port - the actual base port may differ if there is a conflict.
        Returns:
        this instance in frozen state.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the ID's and offsets are conflicting.
        IllegalArgumentException - if this port allocator has already been frozen or closed
        See Also:
        reservePort(String), reservePort(String, int), freeze(int)

      • freeze

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Ports freeze(int basePortHint)
        Uses the registrar and dynamicPortFinder to allocate actual ports for each registered portId and transitions the internal state to USE.
        Parameters:
        basePortHint - the desired base port - the actual base port may differ if there is a conflict.
        Returns:
        this instance, on which now we can call port(String) and getBasePort()

      • getBasePort

        public int getBasePort()
        The lowest port of the allocated block or IllegalStateException if freeze(int) has not been called yet.
        Returns:
        the lowest port of the allocated block.

      • port

        public int port(@NotNull
                @NotNull String id)
        Look up a port for ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the port ID, which we shall look up.
        Returns:
        the port corresponding to the id

      • close

        public void close()

        Releases all resources and transitions the internal state, so that a call to any methods other than close() will result in IllegalStateException.

        This method is idempotent.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
